item.title: 3D Image Slider
item.description: This example demonstrates a 3D rotating cube using CSS animations and transformations. The cube rotates around the Y-axis, and each side of the cube displays a different image. HTML Code <div class="container"> <div class="cube"> <img src="https://assets.lummi.ai/assets/QmW239ythzhEUCVHTDxSzCVaB8wkA16E4hiF6MmNwgRSin?auto=format&w=1500"> <img src="https://assets.lummi.ai/assets/QmQHKeemS2YCLkdTBgQxyFbgwE2RHFr1F51AVhQFFcKCAy?auto=format&w=1500"> <img src="https://assets.lummi.ai/assets/QmS3Y6cMYsRAbXF9t5zmRWwqNttpX65Ev9DvykuHsBCFb6?auto=format&w=1500"> <img src="https://assets.lummi.ai/assets/QmSRo6VjDToFt3xUhNZV2qWBDDq4UPSEsbaq8Es2B5aP1i?auto=format&w=1500"> </div> </div> CSS Code img { position: absolute; width: 240px; height: 240px; backface-visibility: hidden; } .container { width: 240px; height: 240px; perspective: 800px; } .container:before { content: ''; width: 100%; height: 100%; box-shadow: 0 0 75px 20px #0000001a, inset 0 0 350px 350px #0000001a; position: absolute; top: 90px; left: 0px; transform: rotateX(95deg) translateZ(-80px); animation: rotateShadow 16s infinite; } @keyframes rotateShadow { 0% { transform: rotateX(95deg) translateZ(-80px) rotateZ(360deg); } 25% { transform: rotateX(95deg) translateZ(-80px) rotateZ(270deg); } 50% { transform: rotateX(95deg) translateZ(-80px) rotateZ(180deg); } 75% { transform: rotateX(95deg) translateZ(-80px) rotateZ(90deg); } 100% { transform: rotateX(95deg) translateZ(-80px) rotateZ(0deg); } } .
